Modifying File Properties

Modifying a file’s properties creates a new revision of the file, just as checking in a file creates a new revision. If you modify a file property, you should also create a revision comment explaining the reason for the modification.

To modify file properties:

  1. Select and lock a file from the upper pane.

  2. Do one of the following:

    • Select Properties from the File menu or context menu.

    • Click the Properties icon on the toolbar.

    The File Properties dialog opens.

  3. On the General tab, you can change the file name and description. This action changes the name of the working file as well.

  4. Select the Archive tab. The contents of this tab vary, depending upon the file and the client you are using.

  5. If you use the Cross-Platform client to access a file on a server configuration created with StarTeam 6.0 or earlier, the fields that appear depend upon whether the file is Native, PVCS, or VSS.

    6. For Native files, the following fields display:

    • Archive type: Native

    • Compression: Options include None, Maximize Speed, Default (a compromise between speed and compression), or Maximize Compression.

    • Store revisions as deltas: Check box to store text files using the forward delta method. Clear it to store entire file revisions.

    For PVCS or VSS files, the following fields display

    • Archive type: Native, PVCS, or VSS

    • Foreign archive path: Applies to PVCS or VSS files only

  6. With the Windows client (any version) or with the Cross-Platform on the StarTeam 2005 Server or later, the fields that appear depend upon whether the file is Native, PVCS, or VSS.

    7. For Native files, the following fields display:

    • Type: Native

    • Format: Native-I or Native-II

    • Archive File Name: Name of Native File

    • Compression: None or Default

    For PVCS or VSS files, the following fields display

    • Type: PVCS, or VSS

    • Foreign archive path: Path for PVCS or VSS file

  7. Select the Custom tab. If your company uses the application's Repository Customization feature, your administrator may have created additional file properties.

    1. To change a custom property, double-click its name. The Edit Property dialog opens.

    2. Select a new value for the property. For integer, text, and real fields, Value is a text box. For enumerated types and user IDs, it is a list box. For dates and times, Value has a date check box and a time check box, each of which is followed by a date or time in the format for your locale.

    3. If desired, repeat steps a and b for other custom properties.

    4. Select the Comments tab.

    5. Enter the reason for changing the file’s properties in the text box.

  8. Click OK.
